meanings.sent1: She enjoys extolling her friends for their kindness.
meanings.sent2: The community gathered to extoll the bravery of the firefighters.
meanings.sent3: The parrot started extolling the cat's hunting skills, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: The artist's masterpiece was extolled as a beacon of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The coach was extolling the team's hard work and dedication.

meanings.sent1: He was extolling the heroism of the soldiers in his speech.
meanings.sent2: The mayor extolled the volunteers for their selfless service to the community.
meanings.sent3: The comedian jokingly extolled his pet goldfish during the stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins were extolled as symbols of a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was extolling the student's exceptional progress in class.
